Q: How to make Lemon Swirl Lemon curd fudge at home.
O: (A) Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of acetone, and 1 teaspoon lemon extract and 1/4 tsp. yellow food coloring.  After well mixed Swirl 1/2 cup lemon curd gently through fudge, leaving a trail.  Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares. Spread on a baking sheet and bake 20 minutes at 325 degrees F, stirring. (B) Mix Melt 1/2 stick butter with 3 tablespoons brown sugar, 1 teaspoon smoked paprika and 1/4 teaspoon cayenne. Toss with 3 cups mini pretzels and 2 cups mixed nuts. Spread on a baking sheet and bake 20 minutes at 325 degrees F, stirring.

Choice A includes the use of smoked apple and cherry wood chips, which would give the pretzel mix a smoky flavor. Choice B only includes smoked paprika, which may not provide as strong of a smoky flavor. Additionally, the use of mixed nuts in both options adds a nice crunch to the mix.
The answer is (B). The question is asking for the ingredients to make smoky pretzel mix.

Q: how to make slow-cooker polenta
O: (A) Bring 5 cups water, 2 1/2 cups milk and 2 teaspoons kosher salt to a simmer. Pour into an oiled 6-quart slow cooker. Whisk in 1 1/2 cups polenta (not quick-cooking) and add 1 rosemary sprig and 2 bay leaves. Cover and cook on low, stirring halfway through, 2 hours. Discard the rosemary and bay leaves; stir until smooth. Stir in 1 cup Parmesan, 1/2 cup mascarpone and 2 tablespoons butter; season to taste. (B) Bring 5 cups water, 2 1/2 cups milk and 2 teaspoons kosher salt to a simmer. Pour into an oiled 6-quart slow cooker. Fold in three eggs in 1 1/2 cups polenta (not quick-cooking) and add 1 rosemary sprig and 2 bay leaves. Cover and cook on low, stirring halfway through, 2 hours. Discard the rosemary and bay leaves; stir until smooth. Stir in 1 cup Parmesan, 1/2 cup mascarpone and 2 tablespoons butter; season to taste.

Q: how do I make butterscothcies
O: (A) 1 package 2-layer-size yellow cake mix    1/2 cup packed brown sugar    1/2 cup butter, melted    2 eggs    1 cup cashews or toasted pecans, chopped    1 8 - ounce package coffee beans    directions    Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 15x10x1-inch baking pan; set aside.    In a large bowl, combine cake mix, brown sugar, melted butter, and eggs. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack. Cut into bars. Makes 32 bars.
